The mean number of wintering cormorants in each department between 1983 and 2015 was largely related to the surface area of water bodies, small rivers <50 m wide excluded (Spearman's r = 0.545, p < 0.00001, R 2 = 29.7%). However, this relation decreased regularly from a maximum in 1992 (Spearman's r = 0.595, p < 0.00001, R 2 = 35.4%) to a minimum in 2013 (Spearman's r = 0.408, p < 0.00008, R 2 = 16.6%), showing indirectly the increasing use of the suboptimal web of small rivers.
